intro: Apodynomene diffusa, commonly known as the broadleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathium structures, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Apodynomene diffusa is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
